Program Information:
- The program focuses on grassroots community organizations, specifically in the areas of cooperatives, seniors, and community legal services.
- Students will be comfortable in community work roles ranging from direct service to classical advocacy and organizing.
- Students will understand and articulate the special needs of multicultural groups.
- Students will analyze social inequalities and demonstrate creativity in the organization of new services and institutions to meet community needs.
- Students will work with groups to identify their own needs.
- Students will access existing services and community resources.

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition for programs starting in Fall 2022: $3,723.00
- International Tuition for programs starting in Fall 2023: $17,435.00
- Additional costs are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2023 and at later dates.

Financial Assistance:
- The program is approved for OSAP funding, provided the applicant meets OSAP eligibility criteria.

Admission Requirements:
- Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent.
- Grade 12 English (C or U) is required.
- Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English, OR may consider upgrading to achieve the credit(s) needed in English.
- Meeting the minimum requirements does not guarantee admission to the program. Applicants may be required to have grades higher than the minimum stated.

Course Exemptions:
- College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions. More information can be found on the Transfer Guide page.
